Title: Snake In C
Description: This is the game Snake made with C, which I made with a partner for a Systems Programming class assignment. The snake is made up of consecutive letter o's and is controlled by pressing WASD keys or the arrow keys. Numbers from 1-9 will appear on screen in random locations. When the head of the snake collides with the number, the snake grows by that number of o's. The player wins the game when the snake is as long as half the length of the perimeter of the console window. If the snake collides with itself or the walls of the perimeter, the game ends in a loss.

Title: News Site
Description: This was a News App created by myself and a partner for our Web Programming Final Project. We needed to create a website that made calls to an API and required users to register and log in. We also needed to show our understanding of HTML, CSS, and Django. Once the user is logged in, they can type whatever they want into the search bar and hit enter to make a call to News API to receive news articles from all over the web relating to their topic.

Title: Mythrimoire
Description: This the the "dream" game I have wanted to makes since I was young. Four years old playing pretend young, although I didn't know at the time I wanted to turn my imaginary friends A.K.A. "Battle Monsters" (read: Fakemon?) into a video game. While this is very much an ongoing work in progress, I have a basic movement system and enemy AI, as well as a nice sliding pause menu. I have so many more classes/features written but not implemented. I'm sure this is what development hell is.
